alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Martin; Washington (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 22 at 1:45PM EDT until June 22 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Newport has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Washington County in eastern North Carolina... Martin County in eastern North Carolina... Western Beaufort County in eastern North Carolina... * Until 245 PM EDT. * At 144 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Bethel to near Washington to Ernul, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Emergency management. These thunderstorms have a history of producing tree and structure damage. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Washington, Williamston, Plymouth, River Road, Pinetown, Robersonville, Blounts Creek, Wilmar, Cox Crossroads, Wenona, Hinson, Bunyan, Pike Road, Westover, Pleasant Grove, Terra Ceia, Scuppernong, Old Ford, Goose Creek State Park and Chocowinity. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please send your reports of hail and/or wind damage, including trees or large limbs downed, by calling the National Weather Service office in Newport at 1-800-889-6889. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
